<title level="1" pfs="">[Straugh](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2158)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

When skirmishes break out between tunneling [ghouls](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=52) and creatures that dwell beneath the surface of Golarion, there's a chance that ghoul fever could infect such animals, producing strange new variants of ghoul beasts. However, letting the natural corruption run its course sometimes results in unsatisfying monsters, so some necromancers speed the process. This is the situation that led to the creation of the first straugh. A priest of [Kabriri](/Deities.aspx?ID=76) made the monstrosity to defend a claimed cemetery from another sect of ghouls who were preying upon the interred bodies. In some places, ghouls use straughs to tunnel into rival warrens or highly fortified mausoleums.

<column gap="tiny">

([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 29

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 24
</column>

[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +17, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +22, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +17, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +22, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +22

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 29 

**Fort** +22 

**Ref** +16 

**Will** +16 

</row>

**HP** 220
([negative healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=42))

**Immunities**
[death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38)

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 30 feet, burrow 20 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
beak +23,
**Damage** 2d12+12 piercing plus ghoul fever and paralysis

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
talon +23, ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 2d8+12 piercing plus [Improved Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=27) and paralysis

**Consume Flesh** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104)) **Requirements** The straugh is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour; **Effect** The straugh devours a chunk of the corpse and regains 7d6 Hit Points. It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

**Fetid Screech** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Olfactory](/Traits.aspx?ID=246)) Unaware that its vocal organs have withered and decayed, the straugh instinctively but ineffectively attempts to screech, instead releasing malodorous gas, half-digested corpse flesh, and small swarms of maggots from its open beak. The straugh releases a disgusting cloud of gas and decaying detritus in a 15-foot cone; any creature within the area must attempt a DC 28 Fortitude save. On a failure, the creature is [sickened 2](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34). On a critical failure, the creature also takes a –5 foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. Any creature that succeeds at the save is temporarily immune to Fetid Screech for 24 hours.

**Ghoul Fever**  ([Disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46)) **Saving Throw** Fortitude DC 28; **Stage 1** carrier with no effect (1 day); **Stage 2** 4d8 negative damage and regains half as many hit Points from all healing (1 day); **Stage 3** as stage 2 (1 day); **Stage 4** 4d8 negative damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day); **Stage 5** as stage 4 (1 day); **Stage 6** dead, and rises as a [ghoul](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=52) the next midnight

**Paralysis**  ([Incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120), [Necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117)) Any living, non-[elf](/Traits.aspx?ID=58) creature hit by a ghoul antipaladin's attack must succeed at a DC 26 Fortitude save or become [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28). The creature can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

**Rock Tunneler**   A straugh can burrow through solid stone at a Speed of 10 feet. It can leave a tunnel if it desires, and it usually does.

**Tunneling Strike** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([Earth](/Traits.aspx?ID=55)) **Requirements** The straugh has [Burrowed](/Actions.aspx?ID=93) underground and remains [undetected](/Conditions.aspx?ID=39) by the creature it plans to attack; **Effect** The straugh Burrows twice to emerge from the ground adjacent to at least one enemy and immediately makes a Strike against that foe.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="">Hungry Beasts</title>

Some creatures are especially engineered by foul necromancers to have traits like that of ghouls. [Skavelings](/Monsters.aspx?ID=803) and straughs are examples of this. As a GM you can create your own ghoul variants if you wish. _Pathfinder Book of the Dead_ (see [Undead Adjustments](/Rules.aspx?ID=1700)) provides advice on how to accomplish this on the fly with nearly any creature, though some make more sense than others. The best creatures to receive the ghoul treatment are those normally associated with being ravenous and dangerous. When you want a creature that is significantly more powerful than the base creature, it's sometimes best to be your own necromancer and design a ghoul-like undead beast from the ground up to reflect their increased threat level.
</aside>
